skill.name: building-skills
skill.description: Expert at creating and modifying Claude Code skills. Auto-invokes when the user wants to create, update, modify, enhance, validate, or standardize skills, or when modifying skill YAML frontmatter fields (especially 'allowed-tools', 'description'), needs help designing skill architecture, or wants to understand when to use skills vs agents. Also auto-invokes proactively when Claude is about to write skill files (*/skills/*/SKILL.md), create skill directory structures, or implement tasks that involve creating skill components.

security_audit.summary: The skill has a validation script and bash execution capability, but both are controlled and serve legitimate purposes for skill development. No network calls, no credential access, no persistence mechanisms, and no obfuscated code. Risk is appropriate for its development-focused purpose.

medium_findings.title: Bash execution capability for script validation
medium_findings.description: The skill has 'allowed-tools: Read, Write, Edit, Grep, Glob, Bash' which includes Bash execution. The bash capability is used to run validation scripts like 'python3 {baseDir}/scripts/validate-skill.py'. This is appropriate for a skill development tool as it enables schema validation. An attacker with access to this skill could potentially execute arbitrary bash commands if they could manipulate what scripts are called.

content.user_title: Create and manage Claude Code skills
content.value_statement: Creating skills manually is complex and error-prone. This skill provides expert guidance for building, validating, and maintaining Claude Code skills with templates, validation scripts, and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Create new Claude Code skills with proper structure and YAML frontmatter
Validate skill directories against schema requirements
Generate skill templates with best practices
Guide on when to use skills versus agents versus commands
Provide maintenance and migration guidance for existing skills
limitations: Cannot install or register skills in Claude Code automatically
Does not provide agent or command creation directly (use building-agents or building-commands)
Skills must be placed manually in the correct directory

use_cases.title: Build plugin skills
use_cases.description: Create skills for plugin distribution with proper structure, validation, and documentation.

use_cases.title: Standardize team skills
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill patterns and validation across a development team.

use_cases.title: Learn skill creation
use_cases.description: Understand the difference between skills, agents, and commands with guided examples.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called analyzing-data that helps analyze CSV files. Include a validation script and reference documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Validate existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the skill at .claude/skills/my-skill and tell me if it meets all requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Convert agent to skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert my agent to a skill. What changes do I need to make to the YAML frontmatter?

prompt_templates.title: Design skill architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a skill for API documentation. What resources, templates, and scripts should I include?

output_examples.input: Create a skill called writing-tests for unit test generation

best_practices: Use gerund-form names (building-x, analyzing-y) to distinguish skills from agents
Write descriptions that clearly state when Claude should auto-invoke the skill
Use the {baseDir} variable to reference resources instead of hardcoded paths
anti_patterns: Do not include a model field in SKILL.md (only agents support this)
Do not use YAML list format for allowed-tools (must be comma-separated string)
Do not skip the validation step before deploying skills

faq.question: What is the difference between skills and agents?
faq.answer: Skills auto-invoke based on context and use conversation model. Agents require explicit invocation and can specify their own model.

faq.question: Can I use a model field in my skill?
faq.answer: No. Skills cannot have a model field. Only agents support model specification. Remove any model field found.

faq.question: Where do I place created skills?
faq.answer: Skills can go in project-level (.claude/skills/), user-level (~/.claude/skills/), or plugin-level (plugin/skills/) directories.

faq.question: Is the data I create with this skill safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally. The skill only creates and validates files in directories you specify.

faq.question: Why is validation failing on allowed-tools?
faq.answer: Common error: using YAML list format instead of comma-separated string. Use: allowed-tools: Read, Write, Bash

faq.question: When should I use a skill instead of a command?
faq.answer: Use skills for always-on expertise that auto-invokes. Use commands for user-triggered workflows with parameters.
